Description: Glass eye-bath, green, with stem and circular base.
Curator's comments: 'This is almost certainly British on account of the unusual broad, polished bowl lips. Silver eye baths of this shape were made in Edinburgh around 1800. Five Scottish glass houses listed “eye glasses” in their price lists.' (Pers. comm. George Sturrock, Nov 2018).
Possibly taken from UK to Egypt by Winifred Blackman and used by her to treat eye infections of local Egyptian villagers.
Condition: Broken and repaired (glued). Currently in two pieces.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Miss Winifred Susan Blackman (?)
Acquisition notes: Wellcome Historical Medical Museum register records: 'Old eyebath of green glass (broken); used by Mr Lambert's father. ' WHMM Accession register, volume 8 (27900-31100), dated Jan 1927- Oct 1929.
